p:
Clinical trials to measure the effectiveness of CQ (20) at 500 mg of chloroquine diphosphate (corresponding to 300 mg of chloroquine (20) base) per day, for ten consecutive days on the treatment of COVID-19 were performed.
217 Based on results for a very limited number of patients (100), it was concluded that CQ (20) presented apparent efficacy and acceptable safety against COVID-19 associated pneumonia. Borba et al. performed a double-blind, randomised clinical trial designed to assess the safety of CQ (20) in two dosages: 600 mg twice daily for 10 days with an initial dose of 450 mg twice daily on the first day, decreasing to once daily for four more days.
218 The study suggests that the higher dosage should not be recommended for critically ill patients with COVID-19 because of its potential side effects. It is important to note that both doses studied were above the Brazilian recommended dose.
